parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. While the post doesn't explicitly name a candidate, it clearly refers to "viitor deputat" (future deputy), which, in the context of a paid Facebook post by Sebastian Tiberiu Pop, strongly implies he is referring to himself as a candidate for the parliamentary elections.  This fulfills Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and uses inclusive language ("Dragi prieteni," "noi toți," etc.), clearly aiming to reach a wide audience. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The post proposes a legislative initiative aimed at improving the quality of public leadership. While presented as a policy proposal, its primary objective is to enhance the image and credibility of the author (Sebastian Tiberiu Pop) as a future deputy, thereby indirectly influencing voters to support his candidacy. This fulfills Article 36 (7) - c. The post aims to present the candidate as someone who cares about the country and its future, thus influencing voters positively.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post discusses a relevant political issue, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content. It's primarily a promotional piece advocating for a specific policy proposal that directly benefits the author's political aspirations.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post is not a simple expression of personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted message designed to promote the candidate's image and platform, aiming to influence voters' choices in the upcoming elections.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>567876142503416</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post by Sebastian Tiberiu Pop, promoting a legislative initiative regarding mandatory psychological evaluations for public office candidates, constitutes electoral propaganda.  While seemingly policy-focused, the post's context (paid advertisement, self-promotion by a candidate, targeting a wide audience) and objective (enhancing the candidate's image and indirectly influencing votes) clearly align with the definition of electoral propaganda under Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. The post's timing, after the official campaign period, further strengthens this conclusion.  The post does not fall under any of the allowed categories.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>Sebastian Tiberiu Pop</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Sebastian - Tiberiu Pop], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID: 567876142503416), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează o inițiativă legislativă despre evaluări psihologice obligatorii pentru candidați, având ca efect electoral creșterea imaginii și a credibilității candidatului Sebastian Tiberiu Pop, influențând astfel votul alegătorilor. Postarea, deși pare neutră la prima vedere, îndeplinește toate criteriile propagandei electorale conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006, referindu-se direct la candidatură ("viitor deputat"), adresându-se publicului larg și având un obiectiv electoral clar.  Cheltuielile pentru această postare, conform Ad Library, sunt sub 100 RON, ajungând la 1000-2000 de impresii și o estimare a acoperirii de 500.000-1.000.000 de persoane.  Informațiile de contact ale advertiserului sunt disponibile: contact@sebastiantiberiupop.ro și +40760256257.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
